verses.verse: James<WG2385>, a servant<WG1401> of God<WG2316> and<WG2532> of the Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ<WG5547>, to the twelve<WG1427> tribes<WG5443> which<WG1722> are scattered abroad<WG1290>, greeting<WG5463>.
My<WG3450> brethren<WG80>, count it<WG2233> all<WG3956> joy<WG5479> when<WG3752> ye fall<WG4045> into divers<WG4164> temptations<WG3986>;
Knowing<WG1097> this, that<WG3754> the trying<WG1383> of your<WG5216> faith<WG4102> worketh<WG2716> patience<WG5281>.

But<WG1161> let<WG2192> patience<WG5281> have<WG2192> her perfect<WG5046> work<WG2041>, that<WG2443> ye may be<WG5600> perfect<WG5046> and<WG2532> entire<WG3648>, wanting<WG3007> nothing<WG1722><WG3367>.

<WG1161>If any<WG1536> of you<WG5216> lack<WG3007> wisdom<WG4678>, let him ask<WG154> of<WG3844> God<WG2316>, that giveth<WG1325> to all<WG3956> men liberally<WG574>, and<WG2532> upbraideth<WG3679> not<WG3361>; and<WG2532> it shall be given<WG1325> him<WG846>.

But<WG1161> let him ask<WG154> in<WG1722> faith<WG4102>, nothing<WG3367> wavering<WG1252>. For<WG1063> he that wavereth<WG1252> is like<WG1503> a wave<WG2830> of the sea<WG2281> driven with the wind<WG416> and<WG2532> tossed<WG4494>.
For<WG1063> let<WG3633> not<WG3361> that<WG1565> man<WG444> think<WG3633> that<WG3754> he shall receive<WG2983> any thing<WG5100> of<WG3844> the Lord<WG2962>.
A double minded<WG1374> man<WG435> is unstable<WG182> in<WG1722> all<WG3956> his<WG846> ways<WG3598>.
<WG1161>Let<WG2744> the brother<WG80> of low degree<WG5011> rejoice<WG2744> in<WG1722> that he<WG846> is exalted<WG5311>:
But<WG1161> the rich<WG4145>, in<WG1722> that he<WG846> is made low<WG5014>: because<WG3754> as<WG5613> the flower<WG438> of the grass<WG5528> he shall pass away<WG3928>.

For<WG1063> the sun<WG2246> is no sooner risen<WG393> with<WG4862> a burning heat<WG2742>, but<WG2532> it withereth<WG3583> the grass<WG5528>, and<WG2532> the flower<WG438> thereof<WG846> falleth<WG1601>, and<WG2532> the grace<WG2143> of the fashion<WG4383> of it<WG846> perisheth<WG622>: so<WG3779> also<WG2532> shall<WG3133> the rich man<WG4145> fade away<WG3133> in<WG1722> his<WG846> ways<WG4197>.

Blessed<WG3107> is the man<WG435> that<WG3739> endureth<WG5278> temptation<WG3986>: for<WG3754> when he is tried<WG1384><WG1096>, he shall receive<WG2983> the crown<WG4735> of life<WG2222>, which<WG3739> the Lord<WG2962> hath promised<WG1861> to them that love<WG25> him<WG846>.

Let<WG3004> no man<WG3367> say<WG3004> when he is tempted<WG3985><WG3754>, I am tempted<WG3985> of<WG575> God<WG2316>: for<WG1063> God<WG2316> cannot be tempted<WG551><WG2076> with evil<WG2556>, neither<WG1161> tempteth<WG3985> he<WG846><WG3985> any man<WG3762>:
But<WG1161> every man<WG1538> is tempted<WG3985>, when he is drawn away<WG1828> of<WG5259> his own<WG2398> lust<WG1939>, and<WG2532> enticed<WG1185>.
Then<WG1534> when lust<WG1939> hath conceived<WG4815>, it bringeth forth<WG5088> sin<WG266>: and<WG1161> sin<WG266>, when it is finished<WG658>, bringeth forth<WG616> death<WG2288>.
Do<WG4105> not<WG3361> err<WG4105>, my<WG3450> beloved<WG27> brethren<WG80>.

Every<WG3956> good<WG18> gift<WG1394> and<WG2532> every<WG3956> perfect<WG5046> gift<WG1434> is<WG2076> from above<WG509>, and cometh down<WG2597> from<WG575> the Father<WG3962> of lights<WG5457>, with<WG3844> whom<WG3739> is<WG1762> no<WG3756> variableness<WG3883>, neither<WG2228> shadow<WG644> of turning<WG5157>.

Of his own will<WG1014> begat he<WG616> us<WG2248> with the word<WG3056> of truth<WG225>, that<WG1519> we<WG2248> should be<WG1511> a kind<WG5100> of firstfruits<WG536> of his<WG846> creatures<WG2938>.

Wherefore<WG5620>, my<WG3450> beloved<WG27> brethren<WG80>, let<WG2077> every<WG3956> man<WG444> be<WG2077> swift<WG5036> to<WG1519> hear<WG191>, slow<WG1021> to<WG1519> speak<WG2980>, slow<WG1021> to<WG1519> wrath<WG3709>:
For<WG1063> the wrath<WG3709> of man<WG435> worketh<WG2716> not<WG3756> the righteousness<WG1343> of God<WG2316>.

Wherefore<WG1352> lay apart<WG659> all<WG3956> filthiness<WG4507> and<WG2532> superfluity<WG4050> of naughtiness<WG2549>, and receive<WG1209> with<WG1722> meekness<WG4240> the engrafted<WG1721> word<WG3056>, which<WG3588> is able<WG1410> to save<WG4982> your<WG5216> souls<WG5590>.
But<WG1161> be ye<WG1096> doers<WG4163> of the word<WG3056>, and<WG2532> not<WG3361> hearers<WG202> only<WG3440>, deceiving<WG3884> your own selves<WG1438>.

For<WG3754> if any<WG1536> be<WG2076> a hearer<WG202> of the word<WG3056>, and<WG2532> not<WG3756> a doer<WG4163>, he<WG3778> is like<WG1503> unto a man<WG435> beholding<WG2657> his<WG846> natural<WG1078> face<WG4383> in<WG1722> a glass<WG2072>:
For<WG1063> he beholdeth<WG2657> himself<WG1438>, and<WG2532> goeth his way<WG565>, and<WG2532> straightway<WG2112> forgetteth<WG1950> what manner of man<WG3697> he was<WG2258>.

But<WG1161> whoso looketh<WG3879> into<WG1519> the perfect<WG5046> law<WG3551> of liberty<WG1657>, and<WG2532> continueth<WG3887> therein, he<WG3778> being<WG1096> not<WG3756> a forgetful<WG1953> hearer<WG202>, but<WG235> a doer<WG4163> of the work<WG2041>, this man<WG3778> shall be<WG2071> blessed<WG3107> in<WG1722> his<WG846> deed<WG4162>.

If any man<WG1536> among<WG1722> you<WG5213> seem<WG1380> to be<WG1511> religious<WG2357>, and bridleth<WG5468> not<WG3361> his<WG846> tongue<WG1100>, but<WG235> deceiveth<WG538> his own<WG846> heart<WG2588>, this man's<WG5127> religion<WG2356> is vain<WG3152>.

Pure<WG2513> religion<WG2356> and<WG2532> undefiled<WG283> before<WG3844> God<WG2316> and<WG2532> the Father<WG3962> is<WG2076> this<WG3778>, To visit<WG1980> the fatherless<WG3737> and<WG2532> widows<WG5503> in<WG1722> their<WG846> affliction<WG2347>, and to keep<WG5083> himself<WG1438> unspotted<WG784> from<WG575> the world<WG2889>.
